xmlstrings.string: Installation enables you to setup your STB - Antenna, Channel, Satellite, Transponder, CAS, etc
The Archive allows you to playback or delete the programs you have recorded
The EPG displays program information in time and date order and here you can record them
The Channel List provides you with functions such as sorting and editing TV & Radio channel list
The Media Center allows you to browse and view videos, photos, and music from your storage
STB Info provides the STB status including product name and number, free disk space, etc
The Help gives you assistance using PRISMCUBE RUBY
Get current weather and weather forecast for thousands of cities around the world
View your pictures as a slideshow with nice transition effects
Organize your video content by information associated with the video files
Organize your music collection by information stored in your music file ID tag, like title, artist, album, genre and popularity
Add-ons are packages that add features and functions not normally included with the XBMC Media Center
Most of the Media Center's settings can be configured via the GUI under Settings
The File Manager lets you transfer, copy, delete and rename files and folders on your disk drive, FTP-shares, etc
System Info allows you to see your system status
Check your system resource at a glance
The Fav. Addons allow you to add your XBMC addons in the sub-menu and access them easily

property.string: Set Current Position for East Limit
Set Current Position for West Limit

You can setup Language, Video, Audio, Antenna, Satellite, Channel, Time and Date in the First Installation
Antenna Setup enables you to configure Tuner 1 and Tuner 2
Channel Search menu allows you to scan channels automatically or manually
You can add or delete a satellite here
Here you can add or delete transponders
Most of STB settings can be configured via the GUI under Configuration
The Conditional Access System allows you to setup Smartcard configurations
Do you want to apply the rotation limits above?
Select the satellite you want to configure
Select a frequency range sent by the receiver to the LNB
Select the LNB frequency to the LNB you are using
When set to 'On', LNBs will be switched between Low and High band
Select the transponder for the selected satellite
You can control the movements of the motorized antenna here
Set the East and West limit of the DiSEqC motor, in order to protect from damage due to obstacles
Press the OK button to apply the rotation limits for the motor

You have reached the maximum number of\nrecordings allowed

Make media length longer than 30 secs to create a chapter
There is no configured satellite in the list
Select satellites you wish to search from

When set to 'On', new channels are searched from existing transponders and the additional transponders that stored by transponder network however if you set this option to 'Off', only the transponder you selected will be searched
Select the type of channels you want to search for
Press the OK button to search channels

Press the OK button to save the IP address settings
When set to 'Automatic', the time and date will be obtained automatically from the channel that you select

Set the time zone that will be the basis for the date and time display
When set to 'Automatic', the system automatically change over to summer time
Press the OK button to save time settings
Press the OK button to remove everything in the Media Archive
Press the OK button to remove everything in the Record Archive
Press the OK button to erase your hard drive
Go to First Installation after restoring system to the factory default
When set to 'On', the system switches to deep standby mode when you press the 'Power' button to help reduce the amount of electricity used
Set the time for swithcing into standby mode when not being used
Adjust the fan speed level for your system
